Documentation for Karl's VBScript utilities

DocGenerator

Auto-generate script documentation based on well-formed comments

The following is a usage example for the DocGenerator, as well as an example of well-formed comments before the Class statement 
 'Usage Example

 ''    With CreateObject("includer")
 ''        ExecuteGlobal(.read("DocGenerator"))
 ''    End With
 ''    Dim gen : Set gen = New DocGenerator
 ''    gen.SetTitle = "Karl's VBScript documentation"
 ''    gen.SetDocName = "doc.html"
 ''    gen.SetScriptFolder = "../class"
 ''    gen.SetDocFolder = ".."
 
 ''    gen.Generate
 ''    gen.View

Example of well-formed comments before a Sub statement 
 'Method: SubName
 'Parameters: varName, varTyep
 'Remark: A remark is required for Methods (Subs) but not for properties or functions.
Example of well-formed comments before a Property or Function statement 
 'Property: PropertyName
 'Returns a useful string. A Returns (or Return or Returns: or Return:) is required with a Property or Function
 'Remark: A remark is not required for a Property or Function
Notes for the general comment syntax at the beginning of a script
Use a single quote (') for general comments
-- lines without html will be wrapped with p tags
-- lines with html will not be wrapped with p tags
-- use a single quote by itself for an empty line
Use two single quotes for code: the text will be wrapped with pre tags
Use three single quotes for remarks that should not appear in the documentation
Notes for when the script doesn't not contain a Class statement

If the script doesn't contain a class statement, then the general statements at the beginning of the file must be separated from the rest of the file with line that begins with '''' (four single quotes)

Routine type Name Parameter(s) Return value Comment
Method SetScriptFolder a folder N/A Required. Must be set before calling the Generate method. Sets the folder containing the scripts to include in the generated documentation. Environment variables OK. Relative paths OK.
Method SetDocFolder a folder N/A Required. Must be set before calling the Generate method. Sets the folder of the documentation file. Environment variables OK. Relative paths OK.
Method SetDocName a filename N/A Required. Must be set before calling the Generate method. Specifies the name of the documentation file, including the filename extension (.html suggested).
Method SetTitle a string N/A Required. Must be set before calling the Generate method. Sets the title for the documentation.
Method SetFilesToDocument A regular expression N/A Optional. Specifies which files to document: default is .*\.vbs
Method Generate None N/A Generate the docs for the scripts in the specified folder. The doc file will be located in the same folder as the calling script.
Method View None N/A Open the documentation file for viewing

MathConstants

Routine type Name Parameter(s) Return value Comment
Property Pi None 3.14159... None
Property DEGRAD None pi/180 Used to convert degrees to radians
Property RADEG None 180/pi Used to convert radians to degrees

MathFunctions

Math functions not provided with VBScript

The native math functions are Sin, Cos, Tan, Atn, Log

Routine type Name Parameter(s) Return value Comment
Property Sec Angle in radians Secant None
Property Cosec Angle in radians Cosecant None
Property Cotan Angle in radians Cotangent None
Property Arcsin A ratio Arcsine None
Property Arccos A ratio Inverse Cosine None
Property Arcsec A ratio Inverse Secant None
Property Arccosec A ratio Inverse Cosecant None
Property Arccotan A ratio Inverse Cotangent None
Property HSin Hyperbolic angle Hyperbolic Sine None
Property HCos Hyperbolic angle Hyperbolic Cosine None
Property HTan Hyperbolic angle Hyperbolic Tangent None
Property HSec Hyperbolic angle Hyperbolic Secant None
Property HCosec Hyperbolic angle Hyperbolic Cosecant None
Property HCotan Hyperbolic angle Hyperbolic Cotangent None
Property HArcsin X Inverse Hyperbolic Sine of X None
Property HArccos X Inverse Hyperbolic Cosine of X None
Property HArctan X Inverse Hyperbolic Tangent of X None
Property HArcsec X Inverse Hyperbolic Secant of X None
Property HArccosec X Inverse Hyperbolic Cosecant of X None
Property HArccotan X Inverse Hyperbolic Cotangent of X None
Property LogN X, N Logarithm of X to base N None

RegExFunctions

Regular Expression functions - work in progress

RegistryUtility

Provides functions relating to the Windows® registry

Official StdRegProv docs here

Routine type Name Parameter(s) Return value Comment
Property GetStringValue rootKey, subKey, valueName the value of the specified registry entry. The specified registry entry must be of type string (REG_SZ).

Set valueName to vbEmpty or "" to retrieve the default value.

For rootKey, use Property HKLM or HKCU.
Method SetStringValue rootKey, subKey, valueName, value N/A The specified registry entry must be of type string (REG_SZ).

Requires elevated privileges when used with HKLM.

Set valueName to vbEmpty or "" for setting the default value.

For rootKey, use Property HKLM or HKCU.
Property HKLM None &H80000002 Represents HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE. For use with the rootKey parameter.
Property HKCU None &H80000001 Represents HKEY_CURRENT_USER. For use with the rootKey parameter.
Method SetPC a computer name N/A A dot (.) can be used for the local computer (default), in place of the computer name.

ShellConstants

Constants for use with WScript.Shell.Run

Routine type Name Parameter(s) Return value Comment
Property RunHidden None 0 Window opens hidden.
For use with Run method parameter #2
Property RunNormal None 1 Window opens normal.
For use with Run method parameter #2
Property RunMinimized None 2 Window opens minimized.
For use with Run method parameter #2
Property RunMaximized None 3 Window opens maximized.
For use with Run method parameter #2
Property Synchronous None True Script execution halts and waits for the called process to exit.
For use with Run method parameter #3
Property Asynchronous None False Script execution proceeds without waiting for the called process to exit.
For use with Run method parameter #3

SpecialFolders

A kind of enum for use with WScript.Shell.SpecialFolders

Usage example

    With CreateObject("includer")
        ExecuteGlobal(.read("SpecialFolders"))
        ExecuteGlobal(.read("VBSNatives"))
    End With

    Dim sp : Set sp = New SpecialFolders
    Dim n : Set n = New VBSNatives
    MsgBox n.shell.SpecialFolders(sp.Desktop)

Routine type Name Parameter(s) Return value Comment
Property GetList None a string Gets a list of all the properties. Comma + space delimited.

TestingFramework

A lightweight VBScript testing framework, using VBScript

Usage example

    With CreateObject("includer")
        Execute(.read("VBSValidator")) 'ExecuteGlobal if this code is wrapped in a function, class, etc.
        Execute(.read("TestingFramework"))
    End With

    Dim val : Set val = New VBSValidator 'Class Under Test

    With New TestingFramework

        .describe "VBSValidator class"

        .it "should return False when IsBoolean is given a string"

            .AssertEqual val.IsBoolean("sdfjke"), False

        .it "should raise an error when EnsureBoolean is given a string"

            Dim nonBool : nonBool = "a string"

            On Error Resume Next

                val.EnsureBoolean(nonBool)

                .AssertErrorRaised

                Dim errDescr : errDescr = Err.Description 'capture the error information
                Dim errSrc : errSrc = Err.Source

            On Error Goto 0

    End With

Routine type Name Parameter(s) Return value Comment
Method describe unit description N/A Provides a description for the unit under test. E.g. describe "DocGenerator class"
Method it an expectation N/A Provides a description of some expectation to be met by the unit under test. E.g. it "should return an integer"
Method AssertEqual variant1, variant2 N/A Asserts that the specified two variants, of any subtype, are equal.
Method AssertErrorRaised None N/A Asserts that an error should be raised by one or more of the preceeding statements. The statement(s), together with the AssertErrorRaised statement, should be wrapped with a 
 On Error Resume Next 
 On Error Goto 0
block.

TextStreamer

Open a file as a text stream for reading, writing, or appending.

Methods for use with the text stream returned by the Open method:

Reading methods: Read, ReadLine, ReadAll
Writing methods: Write, WriteLine, WriteBlankLines
Reading or Writing methods: Close, Skip, SkipLine
Reading or writing properties: AtEndOfLine, AtEndOfStream, Column, Line

Routine type Name Parameter(s) Return value Comment
Property Open None Returns a text stream object according to the specified settings (methods beginning with Set...) None
Method SetFile a filespec N/A Specifies the file to be opened by the text streamer. Can include environment variables, %wrap%ped in the usual manner. The default file is a random-named .txt file on the desktop.
Method SetForReading None N/A Prepares the text stream to be opened for reading
Method SetForWriting None N/A Prepares the text stream to be opened for writing
Method SetForAppending None N/A Prepares the text stream to be opend for appending (default)
Method SetCreateNew None N/A Allows a new file to be created (default)
Method SetDontCreateNew None N/A Prevents a new file from being created if the file doesn't already exist
Method SetAscii None N/A Sets the expectation that the file will be Ascii (default)
Method SetUnicode None N/A Sets the expectation that the file will be Unicode
Method SetSystemDefault None N/A Uses Ascii or Unicode according to the system default
Method View None N/A Opens the file for viewing
Method SetViewer filespec N/A Sets the filespec of an alternate file viewer to use with the View method.The default viewer is Notepad.
Method Delete None N/A Deletes the streamer file
Method Run None N/A Open/Run the file, assuming it has an executable file extension.

ValidFileName

Provides for removing characters in a string that are not suitable for use in a Windows® file name.

Example of well-formed comments in a script without a Class statement:

A line starting with '''' (four single quotes) separates the general comments at the beginning of the script from the rest of the script

Usage Example


            
    With CreateObject("includer")

            
        ExecuteGlobal(.read("ValidFileName"))

            
    End With

            

            
    MsgBox GetValidFileName("test\ing") 'test-ing

            

            

               

                  Routine type
                  Name
                  Parameter(s)
                  Return value
                  Comment
               

               

                  Property
                  GetValidFileName
                  a file name candidate
                  a valid file name
                  Returns a string suitable for use as a file name: Strips ("\", "/", ":", "*", "?", """", "<", ">", "|", "%20") and replaces them with a hyphen/dash (-)
               

            

         

      


      

         
VBSArguments

         

            
Functions related to VBScript command-line arguments

            

               

                  Routine type
                  Name
                  Parameter(s)
                  Return value
                  Comment
               

               

                  Property
                  GetArgumentsString
                  None
                  a string containing all command-line arguments
                  For use when restarting a script, in order to retain the original arguments. Each argument is wrapped wih quotes, which are typically stripped off as they are read in. The return string has a leading space, by design, unless there are no arguments
               

            

         

      


      

         
VBSEnvironment

         

            

               

                  Routine type
                  Name
                  Parameter(s)
                  Return value
                  Comment
               

               

                  Property
                  Expand
                  a string
                  a string with environment variables expanded
                  Expands environment variable(s); e.g. convert %UserProfile% to C:\Users\user42
               

               

                  Property
                  Collapse
                  a string
                  a string with environment variables collapsed
                  Collapses a string that may contain one or more substrings that can be shortened to an environment variable.
               

               

                  Method
                  CreateUserVar
                  varName, varValue
                  N/A
                  Create or set a user environment variable
               

               

                  Method
                  SetUserVar
                  varName, varValue
                  N/A
                  Set or create a user environment variable
               

               

                  Property
                  GetUserVar
                  varName
                  the value of the specified user environment variable
                  None
               

               

                  Method
                  RemoveUserVar
                  varName
                  N/A
                  Removes a user environment variable
               

               

                  Method
                  CreateProcessVar
                  varName, varValue
                  N/A
                  Create a (temporary) process variable
               

               

                  Method
                  SetProcessVar
                  varName, varValue
                  N/A
                  Sets or creates a (temporary) process environment variable
               

               

                  Property
                  GetProcessVar
                  varName
                  the value of the specified environment variable
                  None
               

               

                  Method
                  RemoveProcessVar
                  varName
                  N/A
                  Removes the specified process environment variable
               

            

         

      


      

         
VBSExtracter

         

            
For extracting a string from a text file, given a regular expression

            

               

                  Routine type
                  Name
                  Parameter(s)
                  Return value
                  Comment
               

               

                  Method
                  SetPattern
                  a regex pattern
                  N/A
                  Specifies the text to be extracted. Non-regex expressions containing any of the regex special characters (  )  .  $  +  [  ?  \  ^  {  | must preceed the special character with a \
               

               

                  Method
                  SetFile
                  filespec
                  N/A
                  Specifies the file to extract text from
               

               

                  Method
                  SetIgnoreCase
                  a boolean
                  N/A
                  Set whether to ignore case when matching text (default=False)
               

               

                  Property
                  Extract
                  None
                  the first string found in the specified file matching the specified pattern
                  Before calling this method, you must specify the file and the pattern
               

            

         

      


      

         
VBSFileSystem

         

            

               

                  Routine type
                  Name
                  Parameter(s)
                  Return value
                  Comment
               

               

                  Property
                  MakeFolder
                  a path
                  False if the folder could not be created.
                  Create a folder, and its parent, grandparent, etc.
               

               

                  Property
                  Parent
                  a string representing a folder or file or registry key
                  the parent of the folder or file or registry key, or removes a trailing backslash
                  The parent need not exist.
               

               

                  Method
                  SetRelativePath
                  a path
                  N/A
                  Call this method, if desired, before calling the property Resolve in order specify the base path against which relative paths should be referenced from. By default, the reference path is the parent folder of the calling script.
               

               

                  Property
                  Resolve
                  a relative path
                  a resolved path
                  Resolves a relative path (e.g. "../lib/WMI.vbs"), to an absolute path (e.g. "C:\Users\user42\lib\WMI.vbs"). The relative path is by default relative to the parent folder of the calling script, but can aslo be set with SetRelativePath. See also property ResolveTo.
               

               

                  Property
                  ResolveTo
                  relativePath, absolutePath
                  a resolved path
                  Resolves the specified relative path (e.g. "../lib/WMI.vbs"), relative to the specified absolute path to another absolute path (e.g. "C:\Users\user42\lib\WMI.vbs")
               

               

                  Property
                  Expand
                  a string
                  an expanded string
                  Expands environment strings. E.g. %WinDir% => C:\Windows
               

            

         

      


      

         
VBSHoster

         

            

               

                  Routine type
                  Name
                  Parameter(s)
                  Return value
                  Comment
               

               

                  Method
                  EnsureCScriptHost
                  None
                  N/A
                  Restart the script hosted with CScript if it isn't already hosted with CScript.exe
               

               

                  Method
                  SetSwitch
                  /k or /c
                  N/A
                  Specifies a switch for %ComSpec% for use with the EnsureCScriptHost method: controls whether the command window, if newly created, remains open (/k). If starting from a console window, use /c (the default).
               

               

                  Method
                  SetDefaultHostWScript
                  None
                  N/A
                  Sets wscript.exe to be the default script host. The User Account Control dialog will open for permission to elevate privileges.
               

               

                  Method
                  SetDefaultHostCScript
                  None
                  N/A
                  Sets cscript.exe to be the default script host. The User Account Control dialog will open for permission to elevate privileges.
               

            

         

      


      

         
VBSLogger

         

            
A lightweight VBScript logger

            
  Instantiation 
            

            
    With CreateObject("includer")

            
        ExecuteGlobal(.read("VBSLogger"))

            
    End With

            
    Dim log : Set log = New VBSLogger

            

            

            
  Usage method one 
            

            
    log "test two"

            

            
This way has the advantage that the log doesn't remain open, allowing other scripts to write to the log.

            

            
  Usage method two 
            

            
    log.Open

            
    log.Write "test one"

            
    log.Close

            

            
This way has the advantage that the name of the calling script is not written on each line of the log.

            

            

               

                  Routine type
                  Name
                  Parameter(s)
                  Return value
                  Comment
               

               

                  Method
                  Log
                  a string
                  N/A
                  Opens the log file, writes the specified string, then closes the log file. This is the default method for the VBSLogger class.
               

               

                  Method
                  SetLogFolder
                  a folder path
                  N/A
                  Customize the log folder. The folder will be created if it does not exist. Environment variables are allowed.
               

               

                  Method
                  Open
                  None
                  N/A
                  Opens the log file for writing. The log file is opened and remains open for writing. While it is open, other processes/scripts will be unable to write to it.
               

               

                  Method
                  Write
                  a string
                  N/A
                  Writes the specified string to the log file.
               

               

                  Method
                  Close
                  None
                  N/A
                  Closes the log file text stream, enabling other process to write to it.
               

               

                  Method
                  View
                  None
                  N/A
                  Opens the log file for viewing. Notepad is the default editor. See SetViewer.
               

               

                  Method
                  SetViewer
                  a filespec
                  N/A
                  Customize the program that the View method uses to view log files
               

               

                  Method
                  ViewFolder
                  None
                  N/A
                  Open the log folder
               

               

                  Property
                  WordPad
                  None
                  a filespec
                  Can be used as the argument for the SetViewer method in order to open files with WordPad when the View method is called.
               

               

                  Property
                  GetDefaultLogFolder
                  None
                  a folder
                  Retrieves the default log folder, %AppData%\VBScripts\logs
               

               

                  Property
                  GetLogFilePath
                  None
                  a filespec
                  Retreives the filespec for the log file.

VBSTestRunner

         

            
Run a test or group of tests

            
Usage example

            

            
    With CreateObject("includer")

            
        ExecuteGlobal(.read("VBSTestRunner"))

            
    End With

            

            
    With New VBSTestRunner

            
        .SetSpecFolder "../spec"

            
        .Run

            
    End With

            

            

               

                  Routine type
                  Name
                  Parameter(s)
                  Return value
                  Comment
               

               

                  Method
                  SetSpecFolder
                  a folder
                  N/A
                  Specifies the folder containing the test files. Can be a relative path, relative to the calling script.
               

               

                  Method
                  SetSpecPattern
                  a regular expression
                  N/A
                  Specifies which file types to run. Default is .*\.spec\.vbs
               

               

                  Method
                  SetSpecFile
                  a single file name / relative path
                  N/A
                  Specifies a single file to test. Include the filename extension. E.g. SomeClass.spec.vbs. A relative path is OK, relative to the spec folder.
               

               

                  Method
                  SetSearchSubfolders
                  a boolean
                  N/A
                  Specifies whether to search subfolders for test files. True or False.
               

               

                  Method
                  Run
                  None
                  N/A
                  Initiate the specified tests
               

            

         

      


      

         
VBSValidator

         

            
An example of how validation might be accomplished.

            

               

                  Routine type
                  Name
                  Parameter(s)
                  Return value
                  Comment
               

               

                  Property
                  IsBoolean
                  a boolean candidate
                  a boolean
                  Returns True if the parameter is a boolean subtype; False if not.
               

               

                  Method
                  EnsureBoolean
                  a boolean candidate
                  N/A
                  Raises an error if the parameter is not a boolean
               

               

                  Property
                  IsInteger
                  an integer candidate
                  a boolean
                  Returns True if the parameter is an integer subtype; False if not.
               

               

                  Method
                  EnsureInteger
                  an integer candidate
                  N/A
                  Raises an error if the parameter is not a boolean
               

               

                  Property
                  ErrDescrBool
                  None
                  a string
                  " is not a boolean." Useful for verifying Err.Description in a unit test.
               

               

                  Property
                  ErrDescrInt
                  None
                  a string
                  " is not an integer." Useful for verifying Err.Description in a unit test.
               

               

                  Property
                  GetClassName
                  None
                  the class name
                  "VBSValidator". Useful for verifying Err.Source in a unit test.
               

            

         

      

      
  See also the  VBScript docs
